page.title: 07Nether Stowey:Local Farmer
page.content: Fred Stockham, a local farming 'character',has lived in Stowey all his life and speaks in the Somerset dialect.He is well into his 70's but very active. He attended the old village school but admits that he often played truant to go fox hunting. He used to make a living selling timber. He then went into sheep farming and for forty years has kept a large flock on the Quantock Hills, where he has commoners' rights. He keeps 250 breeding ewes and their lambs. They are periodically brought down for dipping, branding, or to be sheared. It costs 50 pence to shear a sheep today. The value of a fleece is about Â£3.00. The problem of sheep worrying has worsened with increased accessibility of the hills to townspeople owning cars. By law, Fred may shoot dogs caught worrying sheep.
